body:
I love the idea, but it just won't work - here's why:

1. If there are 3 users in the guild and 2 are the same person, that person could cast their 2 votes in favor of removal and they would automatically become guildmaster.
2. If you make it so only active users could do this you risk the potential of starting an oligarchy.
3. There's always a possibility of people blindly voting yes or no when they don't know what they're talking about.

The best solution for now is to just have a way for users to report guildmasters to the admins and then have the admins look into it.
body_html:
I love the idea, but it just won't work - here's why:

  1. If there are 3 users in the guild and 2 are the same person, that person could cast their 2 votes in favor of removal and they would automatically become guildmaster.
  2. If you make it so only active users could do this you risk the potential of starting an oligarchy.
  3. There's always a possibility of people blindly voting yes or no when they don't know what they're talking about.

The best solution for now is to just have a way for users to report guildmasters to the admins and then have the admins look into it.

body:
This has been discussed multiple times and the consensus is that abusing the system with bot voting or sending mobs to actively steer the results would be way too easy. Not only that but implementing such a system would just not be worth the effort. Also I think people are overthinking it. I know that a lot of people who come here traumatized by reddit but you're all going to overbalance in the other direction and make ruqqus a chaotic shitshow where anyone can bully and remove anyone from anywhere. That's not going attract anyone to this site, neither regular users nor guild masters. I for one would certainly not put the effort in managing a guild and filling it with content for free if I knew that some 4chan shithead could dethrone me in an instant. 

Generally I think having multiple guilds on the same topic is the way to go. Don't like what guildmasters are doing in one of them, just move to the other one. Kinda like a free competitive market. It is easier to maintain and is abuse-proof. The admins only have to implement an algorithm that suggests similar guilds so that even the smaller guilds about the same topic can grow. This way guildmasters who are interested in growing their guilds will actually put the effort to make the guilds fair and enjoyable to everyone.
